projects.title: 2D-3D Floor-Plan Generator
projects.short: Turns CAD floor-plans into textured 3D VR-ready models.
projects.long:
A tool that attempts to save time for architects in having to visualize house/floor plans for clients in 3D.

Elaborating on the problem statement a little more, architects usually design house plans in 2D using some CAD software. These CAD files (.dwg,.cad,.dxf) are great and serve most realistic purposes but home owners like to visualize their homes in a proper 3D manner before settling down on one. This in turn, entails the architects having to make 3D models themselves or having to ask people to make 3D models for them.

The manual 3D modelling usually takes up about 1-2 hours of the architects time. The solution cuts down on the time required from prep from 1-2 hours down to 5-10 minutes and automates most of the 3D generation.

The user imports the 2D floor plan from a simple .exe and then in turn receive a complete 3D model that is viewable in VR right out the gate with proper materials/textures assigned to it. Uses Python as the backend to parse the CAD files and then uses Unreal to swap in models/textures/material from a huge library of presets.

projects.title: the everything bagel
projects.short: a website consisting of various functionalities/datasets mostly for fun but could be utilized for productivity.
projects.long:
A website consisting of various sections pertaining to multiple functionalities. Inspired by the movie Everything Everywhere All at Once by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert. The whole idea is a combination of various online datasets (all mostly through open source APIs) into a meaningful format - making a fun and mostly silly yet slightly productive experience.

Main Components:

1. Art: Query and fetch art pieces from major museums (Metropolitan Museum of Modern Art and Chicago Art Museum) - over 700k art pieces available for browsing.

2. World Information: Real-time world data including IP/email/DNS geolocation, world registered domains search, forex rates, and Indian postal codes lookup.

3. Every Day is Special: Historical events, notable births and deaths for any given day to make dull days more interesting.

4. Analytics and Data: Name-based estimations (age/gender/nationality guessing) and unified metadata fetching for any website URL.

5. Religious Stuff: Random verses from three holy books: Bhagavad Gita, Bible, and Quran.

6. Silly Things: Random cat/dog facts and images, plus fox and duck sections for entertainment.

projects.title: MR HMG Simulator
projects.long:
A MR based Machine Gun simulator made for the Varjo XR-3. The experience is setup with a green screen on which the MR content is displayed. Features a real gun from which trigger, position data is received and reflected inside of the simulator [serial ports].

The specifications have to be as generic as possible because of a signed NDA: The ballistics have been coded to simulate real gun's ballistics as much as possible. From the gun's specifications to the bullet's specifications are all accurately done.

The bullet has a specified ballistic coefficient: takes in form factor, mass, diameter etc. The gun also can have additional spread, different fire modes, switching of the ammo/bullet-types depending on the configuration.

Has multiple modes of training too, from zeroing to tactical marksmanship all in accordance to the [redacted] Army specifications. The full interface also has CRC-16 checksums at both the receiver and the sender to ensure full data integrity.

The simulator features multiple realistic environments and weather conditions including snowy mountain terrain, temperate grasslands, rocky desert landscapes, and arctic conditions with dynamic weather effects like snowfall. These diverse environmental settings provide comprehensive training scenarios for different operational conditions and tactical situations.


Plus a lot of 'more' specific and intricate trainings which I unfortunately can't reveal but have been coded in C++/Blueprints using Unreal Engine.

projects.title: wusic — Minimal Music Player
projects.short: Distraction-free music player born from personal frustrations with typical music apps.
projects.long:
A music player designed from personal experience with choice paralysis (always ending up with Kanye!) and distracting music interfaces. Built for focused work/study sessions with thoughtful UX choices:

- Swipe-based album view instead of overwhelming lists, forcing more deliberate music choices
- Intentional long-press to play mechanism that discourages frequent switching
- Single-click dark mode and fullscreen toggles (no more digging through menus!)
- Clean, consistent aesthetic with minimal UI elements

Features offline music library management with custom sorting and integrated lofi-music streams. The entire design philosophy stems from real frustrations with existing players, creating something that's both visually pleasing and mindfully engineered to reduce distractions.
